  "description": "Worknigeria - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager (Construction)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Project Manager &ndash; Construction to lead the planning, execution, and successful delivery of structural steel and metal fabrication / installation projects.
	The role involves overseeing project schedules, budgets, and quality standards while coordinating with engineers, architects, general contractors, subcontractors, and field teams.
	The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of steel erection, fabrication, and industry codes, with a proven track record of delivering commercial and industrial projects on time and within budget.


Key Responsibilities
Project Planning &amp; Execution:


	Develop and manage detailed project schedules, budgets, and work plans.
	Coordinate pre-construction activities including shop drawing reviews, submittals, and RFIs.
	Ensure all phases of steel fabrication and installation meet quality, safety, and compliance standards.


Financial &amp; Contract Management:


	Review and negotiate project contracts, supplier agreements, and subcontractor scopes.
	Monitor and control project costs, prepare progress reports, and manage change orders.
	Ensure projects are delivered profitably while maintaining client satisfaction.


Team &amp; Stakeholder Leadership:


	Lead, mentor, and support site superintendents, foremen, and field crews.
	Serve as the primary point of contact with clients, GCs, engineers, and other stakeholders.
	Foster strong relationships with partners to drive repeat business.


Safety &amp; Compliance:


	Enforce OSHA and company safety standards across job sites.
	Conduct risk assessments and ensure projects comply with building codes and regulatory requirements.


Project Close-Out:


	Oversee punch lists, final inspections, and warranty documentation.
	Deliver accurate close-out packages and ensure client satisfaction.


Requirements
Preferred Qualifications:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field.
	7+ years of project management experience in steel and metal construction.
	PMP certification or equivalent is a plus.
	Track record of successfully managing teams and delivering complex projects.


Technical Skills:


	Strong knowledge of structural steel design, fabrication, and erection practices.
	Proven experience with steel/metal construction projects.
	Proficiency in project management tools (MS Project, Planner, Bluebeam, or equivalent).
	Ability to interpret structural drawings, shop drawings, and specifications.
	Strong understanding of safety regulations and quality standards.


Soft Skills:


	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and time-management abilities.
	Detail-oriented with proven problem-solving skills under tight deadlines.
	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work on landmark steel and metal construction projects.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative, innovative, and safety-driven work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@worknigeria.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Project Manager (Construction) Job at Worknigeria




        
    

        
        Worknigeria - Our client is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Manager (Construction)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Project Manager – Construction to lead the planning, execution, and successful delivery of structural steel and metal fabrication / installation projects.
	The role involves overseeing project schedules, budgets, and quality standards while coordinating with engineers, architects, general contractors, subcontractors, and field teams.
	The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of steel erection, fabrication, and industry codes, with a proven track record of delivering commercial and industrial projects on time and within budget.


Key Responsibilities
Project Planning & Execution:


	Develop and manage detailed project schedules, budgets, and work plans.
	Coordinate pre-construction activities including shop drawing reviews, submittals, and RFIs.
	Ensure all phases of steel fabrication and installation meet quality, safety, and compliance standards.


Financial & Contract Management:


	Review and negotiate project contracts, supplier agreements, and subcontractor scopes.
	Monitor and control project costs, prepare progress reports, and manage change orders.
	Ensure projects are delivered profitably while maintaining client satisfaction.


Team & Stakeholder Leadership:


	Lead, mentor, and support site superintendents, foremen, and field crews.
	Serve as the primary point of contact with clients, GCs, engineers, and other stakeholders.
	Foster strong relationships with partners to drive repeat business.


Safety & Compliance:


	Enforce OSHA and company safety standards across job sites.
	Conduct risk assessments and ensure projects comply with building codes and regulatory requirements.


Project Close-Out:


	Oversee punch lists, final inspections, and warranty documentation.
	Deliver accurate close-out packages and ensure client satisfaction.


Requirements
Preferred Qualifications:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or a related field.
	7+ years of project management experience in steel and metal construction.
	PMP certification or equivalent is a plus.
	Track record of successfully managing teams and delivering complex projects.


Technical Skills:


	Strong knowledge of structural steel design, fabrication, and erection practices.
	Proven experience with steel/metal construction projects.
	Proficiency in project management tools (MS Project, Planner, Bluebeam, or equivalent).
	Ability to interpret structural drawings, shop drawings, and specifications.
	Strong understanding of safety regulations and quality standards.


Soft Skills:


	Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
	Strong leadership, organizational, and time-management abilities.
	Detail-oriented with proven problem-solving skills under tight deadlines.
	Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits package.
	Opportunity to work on landmark steel and metal construction projects.
	Career growth and professional development opportunities.
	A collaborative, innovative, and safety-driven work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@worknigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

Warehouse Supervisor Job at Sales Force Consulting




        
    

        
        Sales Force Consulting (a subsidiary of SF Metrics & Analytics limited) - Our client is a major manufacturing company that deals in diverse products like polypropylene bags, nails, wire mesh, etc, with key factories located in Bridgehead Industrial Estate, Onitsha.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Supervisor
Job Location: Onitsha, Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time
Interview Mode: Physical

Responsibilities


	Demand forecasting
	Inventory documentation and management
	Stock count
	Supervisory role.


Requirements
     

            
    




	HND / B.Sc in related courses
	Minimum of 2 years of practical post NYSC work experience from a production company
	Extensive knowledge ofwarehousing and inventory management.


Other Conditions:


	They must be very hardworking, organized, with high level of integrity
	Ideal candidates should presently reside in Onitsha axis or can easily procure accommodation.
	He must preferably have worked or is currently working in a production coy in similar role


Skill Set:


	Ability to work independently with little supervision.
	Attention to details
	Leadership skills.


Salary
N150,000 / month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV (PDF or Word) to: salesforceconsultingng@gmail.com using “Warehouse Supervisor" as the subject of the email.

Note


	For enquiries: Text or Whatsapp 08120796570 (No calls)
	Only candidates who meet set criteria shall be shortlisted for invitation.

Credit Control Officer Job at ipNX Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        ipNX is one of Nigeria’s fastest growing Information and Communications Technology companies, serving a multitude of needs across enterprises, small businesses and residents with innovative, world-class services.

Our ability to identify, satisfy and exceed today’s market needs is a testament to over a decade of experience, our commitment, drive and passion realized through highly skilled and well seasoned professionals.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Credit Control Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	To ensure consistent operational cash inflow into the business by regular billing of customers and receivable management in strict compliance with credit policy.


Responsibilities


	Ensure money collectable from sales and takings are received in collection accounts and are fully reconciled to bank in order to block all cash leakages and loss of fund which may result in shareholders’ fund depletion.
	Ensure WHT receipts are collected, properly accounted for and allocated in accordance with the company’s credit policy.
	Follow up on receivable in accordance to the credit policy, collect and allocate payments
	Ensure timely reconciliation whenever there is disparity between customer’s payment and invoices
	Ensure the receivable aging complies with the company credit policy
	Weekly submission of Follow up Reports and monthly submission of Credit policy compliance report


Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of 2.2 / Upper Credit B.Sc Degree / HND in Accounting or any related course
	Not more than 2 years of experience in Credit Control
	Ability to optimize work processes
	Knowledge of general accounting principles
	Knowledge of debit and credit
	Proficiency in Excel
	Knowledge of accounts receivables
	Customer relationship management.


Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
